docs.lead_paragraph: Passengers could have their temperature checked or be subject to detailed questioning, but health officials cautioned against more draconian measures like travel bans.

headline.main: Health Officials Promise Extra Airport Screening for Ebola
headline.print_headline: Health Officials Promise Extra Airport Screening

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention officials promise additional measures to screen airline passengers arriving in United States for Ebola virus; remain opposed to draconian travel restrictions such as outright bans, saying that they would cause more problems than they would solve.
docs.snippet: Passengers could have their temperature checked or be subject to detailed questioning, but health officials cautioned against more draconian measures like travel bans.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: After the company drew negative publicity in March for denying a drug to a child, its stock jumped as that drug has shown promise in treating Ebola.

headline.main: Experimental Ebola Drug Puts Its Maker, Chimerix, Back in the Spotlight
headline.print_headline: Experimental Ebola Drug Has Its Maker, Chimerix, Back in the Spotlight

docs.snippet: After the company drew negative publicity in March for denying a drug to a child, its stock jumped as that drug has shown promise in treating Ebola.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite requests for the “moon suits” that Ebola workers in Africa wear, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has not changed its recommendations on protective gear.

headline.main: As Anxiety Increases, Agency Scrambles to Address Concerns of Health Workers
headline.print_headline: As Anxiety Increases, U.S. Agency Scrambles to Address Health Workers’ Concerns

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention scrambles to address concerns from health workers nationwide as anxiety mounts over Ebola virus; agency has scheduled two nationwide conference calls, but has so far not changed its recommendations on protective gear.
docs.snippet: Despite requests for the “moon suits” that Ebola workers in Africa wear, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has not changed its recommendations on protective gear.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: The nurse’s husband and two other people were quarantined, and monitoring was extended to 50 other people who might have come into contact with her.

headline.main: Demands for an Explanation Grow After a Nurse in Spain Contracts Ebola
headline.print_headline: Demands for an Explanation Grow After a Nurse in Spain Contracts Ebola

docs.abstract: Spain's government comes under heavy criticism for its handling of Western Europe's first Ebola case, as health care workers argue that they have not been given proper training or equipment to handle the disease; government quarantines three more people and monitors dozens who had come into contact with infected nurse.
docs.snippet: The nurse’s husband and two other people were quarantined, and monitoring was extended to 50 other people who might have come into contact with her.
